alert.note: Alert for Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 8:34PM CDT until May 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Yoakum. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms continues to move through the county. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - The West Texas Mesonet west of Denver City measured 1.83 inches of rain through 825 PM. The gauge at Plains measured nearly nine tenths of ain inch. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Denver City, Plains and Bronco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
